title: vintage sans serif and retro style script
content:
Hi, would anyone know what fonts are these?

thanks in advance!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Imagen-1_4684.jpg)

Font: 

 Custom Gothic, Spoleto 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")
author: mariano

comments.content:
"LOW TIDE..." is very close to **[SVN Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=URW&ffam=Snv%20Becker%20Reg%20Cond%20-%20Regular&fid=ea5f3856e4c8ae4841e522903039a20d&fsize=60&text=LOW%20TIDE%20HIGH%20TIDE&wrap=2)** by URW++

For "To" and "Seaside" take a look at the following thread about Aktuelle aka Spoleto aka OPTISport aka Athletic Script:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/70274](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/typophile.com/node/70274 "http://typophile.com/node/70274")

LOW TIDE/HIGH TIDE: it's actually a roughen version of Hollister's own corporate font called "Custom Gothic" (complete alphabet coming from their website shown below). Similars: [Alternate Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/alternate-gothic) No.2, [League Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/League-Gothic), [Bebas](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/Bebas), [Oswald](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/oswald), [Trade Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/trade-gothic) Condensed no.20, [Veneer](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/yellow-design/veneer), [Anodyne](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/yellow-design/anodyne), [Ultramagnetic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.youworkforthem.com/product.php?sku=T0020), [Vinyl](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/vinyl), [Stacker](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wordshape/stacker), [Langdon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.stevenbonner.com/projects/langdon), [Bellamie](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeart/bellamie), [Growly Grin](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.dafont.com/growly-grin.font), [FF Dirty Faces Seven One anb Two](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_dirty_faces_2_ot)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504im_/http:/typophile.com/files/custom-gothic_6310.png)

Good explanation of the Hollister font by the designer: [Moraitis Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317164504/http:/www.moraitisdesign.com/portfolio/hollister-co-logotype-font-refinement-and-expansion/)  
Don
